Message.Title: Sidelines View
Message.Msg: 1. The results at DuPont and Dow Chemical point to reductions in world industrial production and inventory levels to adjust to reduced demand. Europe may not fall apart but it looks like a global slowdown lead by Europe. Buffett says Asia is also slowing. 2. Without any other catalyst to match on the horizon, I'd rather buy IBM into a Romney rally than hold into an Obama sell-off. Regardless of the election, world demand is dropping. That's what really counts in the next year.
LOL!!!!!LOL!!!!!!! Everybody I know is switching to AAPL so I don't know where you get your info

Topic.Title: ibm headed for low 180's before bottoming

Message.Msg: Does the company have value? Does it pay a decent dividend? Who cares what the price is or what any particular quarterly report is? Chasing short term price is a losers quest. Poor people, watching tv shows, sponsored by trading companies, urging you to Trade, Trade, Trade. When asked what was his average holding time for stocks was, Warren Buffett said, "Forever!" But please, keep on pretending that you can predict the future, it's amusing.

The global economy is slowing. Many multinational firms have confirmed a global economic slowdown. I hope it is just a correction, and not a full-blown recession. If it is a recession, our markets will take a hit. This bull market is more than three and a half years old. Maybe, this correction will turn into a bear market? I am not banking on politics to provide any short term rally. I will continue to hold IBM shares long, and expect 2013 to be rather difficult. It is wise to continue to monitor the conference calls and earnings reports from the companies you own. I once held Eastman-Kodak until is was clear they were a failed business model. OUCH!

Android outsells Apple 3 to 1 in smartphones, and that number continuously climbs. IPad is keeping Apple afloat for now..I Phone market share will continue to decline as the likes of Samsung eat their lunch. When you say 'everyone'...you must live in a small world. Apples best days are already behind them

Message.Title: Toy makers are chasing each other(AAPL, HPQ, GOOG, AMZN...)
Message.Msg: Who will come with the best toy then can stay at top for a while. AAPL days are numbered before next toy maker takes over. Meanwhile, IBM that world depend on its software/hardware is progressing at slow rate but no one can push it aside. IBM does not make toy but the real products needed to run business and goernment.

Message.Title: Most business can be run without AAPL toys but most businesses can't be run without IBM products
Message.Msg: When it comes to run a big successful business, you need IBM but not any of AAPL toys.

Message.Title: IBM is a must but AAPL is not when other companies can do AAPL job easily
Message.Msg: So, sooner or later many companies will make the same toys AAPL is making at cheaper price but it is rarely if a company can immitate IBM.

Message.Title: IBM will stay around current price when the market is in red
Message.Msg: It will be very hard to push IBM lower if the market goes lower. It the market picks up then IBM will be ahead of other companies.

Message.Title: AAPL & AMZN
Message.Msg: AAPL and AMZN reported earnings this afternoon, and they are consistent with the weakness we have seen in corporate earnings this quarter. These two reports will continue the recent correction we have seen in the markets. The correction will continue!

Message.Title: IBM is producing real value for businesses
Message.Msg: IBM is helping businesses instead of robbing kids out of their money for iPad or iPod.
The correction for most stocks are done. AAPL lost over 15%, IBM over 10%, INTC over 25%... So, get a good reliable stock like IBM that did not miss its income and it did not guide lower.
